default.title: Default template
default.tooltip: Set the default template for all folders if they are not registered

filterAnyFolderCommand.desc:
Will remove user-defined templates from the "all folders" list. 
If disabled, will display defined templates with their paths rather than their command name.
filterAnyFolderCommand.title: Filter the list of the "all folders" command

allFolder.listAllModals: List all folders in quick-switcher, instead to open another modal

alreadyExist.desc: If you do not open the notes upon creation, it still allows you to open the file if it already exists.
alreadyExist.focus: Focus on the already existing note
alreadyExist.title: Default opening of notes that already exist

editFolder.default: Default template for all folders if they are not registered

fileName.desc: The name will be incremented if the name already exists.
fileName.title: Choose how notes will be named.

focus.desc: Focus on the new note after creation
focus.title: Focus

increments.desc: Disabled, will not increment the name if the file already exists and open the already existing note instead.
increments.title: Increments the name if the file already exists

opening.desc: How note will be opened after creation
opening.head: Opening
opening.title: Default Opening

setting.desc: Add a button in the file menu to create a note in this folder. Only works if the folder path contains "{{current}}" or use the clicked folder.
setting.title: File menu

template.title: Choose a template if you want to add something before or after the filename.

setting.desc: Allow to trigger a template from the templater plugin
setting.title: Template path

editFolder.title: Edit Folder specific settings

error.date: Invalid date format, please use a valid format.
error.fileName: Invalid file name, please use a filename if you don't use a template.
error.invalidExpression: File name cannot contain any of the following characters: *, ", , /, <, >, :, |, ?
error.templateNotFile: {{- path}} is not a valid file.

log: Creating note in path {{- path}}, with name {{- name}}

template.desc: The filename can be empty if you use a template.
template.error: No files were found in the templater folder.

position.title: Choose where to add the template.

title: Folders

current.desc: You can use the {{current}} variable to use the current folder.
current.warning: ⚠️ You need to have a file already open to use the command.

desc.explain: Custom variables will be replaced by their value upon creation.
desc.filename: You can use custom variables in the folder path.
desc.insensitive: Without a regex, the name will be case-sensitive, including the "date" type.

regex.info: To use a name with a RegEx, enclose it by "/"

warn.usage: To use the variable, you need to enclose the name in "{{}}" in the folder path.
